page.title: 16 Holywell Farm
page.content: The farm used to have 220 acres but the present owner has sold parcels of the land for the Pig Farm at Wildmere Farm, a smaller general purpose farm and 100 acres of arable land,which used to be waterlogged, to a Haulage and Agricultural Contractor. The owner now has only 30 acres. There is a Suffolk Barn, built in 1776 and constructed of timber from wooden ships that were replaced by metal hull ships. The curved timber from the bows of the ships can be seen supporting the roof. The building has recently been listed as a building of special interest. The dried beds of some ponds on this farm can be seen and these ponds were once used by Monks from a Monastery at Eriswell,to breed and keep trout and other fish for their food supply.
